title: (x) "huga" script w/ underlining swash - various {Mike Y}
content:
sorry about the bad quality of the pic.   
   
Or maybe can you help me to find a type who look like this one...   
thanks ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021092837im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47632.jpg)
author: weeliam

comments.content:
There seems to be a real 'thing' going on for type with underlining swashes.   
   
I think usually the swashes are not part of the fonts that are used. They are drawn and added on.   
   
However, there are three fonts I know that have swashes included. You still need to use a graphics application like Illustrator to adjust the swashes, but we had a post about this recently and we [provided links](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021092837/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/42935.html) for three fonts we know.
